content.title: Get Started
content.shortContent: What is Bootstrap? Why Use Bootstrap? Where to Get Bootstrap?

content.title: Grid Basic
content.shortContent: Bootstrap's grid system allows up to 12 columns across the page.

content.title: Text/Typography
content.shortContent: In this chapter, we will look at some HTML elements that will be styled a little bit different by Bootstrap than browser defaults.

content.title: Glyphicons
content.shortContent: Bootstrap provides 200 glyphicons from the Glyphicons Halflings set. Glyphicons can be used in text, buttons, toolbars, navigation, forms, etc.

content.title: Badges/Labels
content.shortContent:
Badges are numerical indicators of how many items are associated with a link:
News 5 Comments 10 Updates 2

content.title: Tables
content.shortContent: A basic Bootstrap table has a light padding and only horizontal dividers. The .table class adds basic styling to a table.

content.title: Images
Jumbotron
content.shortContent: A jumbotron indicates a big box for calling extra attention to some special content or information. A jumbotron is displayed as a grey box with rounded corners.

content.title: Wells
content.shortContent: The .well class adds a rounded border around an element with a gray background color and some padding. Change size of the well:.well-sm (small), .well-lg (large).

content.title: Alerts
content.shortContent: Alerts are created with the .alert class, followed by one of the four contextual classes <span class='code-span'>.alert-success, .alert-info, .alert-warning or .alert-danger

content.title: Panels
content.shortContent: A panel in bootstrap is a bordered box with some padding around its content. Panels are created with the .panel class, and content inside the panel has a .panel-body class.

content.title: Buttons
content.shortContent: Bootstrap provides seven styles of buttons:

content.title: Button Groups
content.shortContent: Bootstrap allows you to group a series of buttons together (on a single line) in a button group:

content.title: Progress Bars
content.shortContent:
A progress bar can be used to show a user how far along he/she is in a process.
70% Complete

content.title: Pagination
content.shortContent:
If you have a web site with lots of pages, you may wish to add some sort of pagination to each page.
  • 1
  • 2
  • 3
  • 4
  • 5

content.title: Pager
content.shortContent:
Pager is also a form of pagination but it provides previous and next buttons (links).
  • Previous
  • Next

content.shortContent:
• First item
  • Second item
  • Third item

content.title: Dropdowns
content.shortContent:
A dropdown menu is a toggleable menu that allows the user to choose one value from a predefined list:
  • HTML
  • CSS
  • JavaScript

content.title: Scrollspy
content.shortContent: The Scrollspy plugin is used to automatically update links in a navigation list based on scroll position.

content.title: Forms
content.shortContent: Form controls automatically receive some global styling with Bootstrap: All textual <input>, <textarea>, and <select> elements with class .form-control have a width of 100%.

content.title: Inputs
content.shortContent: Bootstrap supports all the HTML5 input types: text, password, datetime, datetime-local, date, month, time, week, number, email, url, search, tel, and color.

content.title: Inputs 2
content.shortContent: If you need to insert plain text next to a form label within a horizontal form, use the .form-control-static class on a <p> element.

content.title: Input Sizing
content.shortContent: Set the heights of input elements using classes like .input-lg and .input-sm. Set the widths of elements using grid column classes like .col-lg-*and .col-sm-*.

content.title: Carousel
content.shortContent: The Carousel plugin is a component for cycling through elements, like a carousel (slideshow).

content.title: Modal
content.shortContent:
The Modal plugin is a dialog box/popup window that is displayed on top of the current page:

Modal Header

Some text in the modal.

content.title: Tooltip
content.shortContent:
The Tooltip plugin is small pop-up box that appears when the user moves the mouse pointer over an element:
Hover over me

content.title: Popover
content.shortContent:
The Popover plugin is similar to tooltips; it is a pop-up box that appears when the user clicks on an element. The difference is that the popover can contain much more content.
Click To Toggle Popover

content.title: Collapse (collapse.js)
content.shortContent: Get base styles and flexible support for collapsible components like accordions and navigation. Plugin dependency: Collapse requires the transitions plugin to be included in your version of Bootstrap.
